Warning: I once had this exact experience and I ended up fixing and re-building with bors like 10 times cause only one test fails at a time.
the experience, to be clear, was that a coverage report test was failing
can someone confirm this experience? I.e., is this something where bors in principle should be providing feedback about more failing tests, but is not doing so?

Right. The coverage report tests will stop after one fails. The output includes a ton of code comments with implementation notes not relevant when running the test (from a shell script I think?). And I couldn't find instructions to run the tests locally.
With other test suites, all of the tests will run and show all failures and diffs at once so that's what I expected.
It seems like it's an issue with coverage tests in particular, rather than bors?
